title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message:
820-3462-A A1425 ssd doesn't appear 
I think they tried a ssd converter on it and now not even its original ssd appear. 
I get 3.3v on J4500 as instructed by its schematics. 
Where should I focus now? 
(Smc...) (U4900....) It goes through U4900. Could the problem be on U4900? 
Device works but ssd doesn't appear at all.

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message:
Boot USB macOS and check if internal SSD is at least det4ected in Disk Utility.
This test is good to discard a problem with partitions; like deleted, or APFS.

Check first L4500/10.

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message:
hi,
i already checked it L4500  i wrote above text  ([U]I get 3.3v on J4500[/U] ) so do i need to check U4900 (Smc) ?
And also I checked ssd cable and tried diffrent cable but doesnt see ssd. And i checked ssd with different device, it works.

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message:
"i already checked it L4500"
What about L4510?

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message: Remember to change the view in Disk Utility to show all devices and partitions rather than just valid volumes.

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message: I get 3.3v on I4500 and 5v on L4510 but this line cannot be used for SSD. I think it's SATA GUMSTICK2. For normal HDD, I get 3.3v on 1 to 14 on J4500. The owner said that it's been like this since they tried to replace the SSD.

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message: Then check for knocked off components, or broken traces.

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message:
SATA_SSDRHDD_D2R_P , SATA_SSDRHDD_D2R_N, SATA_SSDRHDD_R2D_P, SATA_SSDRHDD_R2D_N
There are 4 lines through the hdd socket, none of which seems damaged.If you could be more explanatory, I can move forward more easily Could you give me directions from the schematics on which path should I take or which lines should I test?

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message:
Check R4506/07/08/10 and C4517/18/22/25.
Also check diode mode to ground on these lines.

Try known good SSD flex too.
Do not trust new chinese bulshits.

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message:
On J4500 from its 20-22 R4506 and R4507 seems to be working. There is line between the socket and resistors. Resistors are in fine shape. 
Also on J4500, 36-38, on R4510 & R4508 there is line to the resistors and they are working as well. 
I checked 4517, 4518, 4522, 4525 capacitors, all are 10nf

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message: You should check diode mode to ground on data lines.

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71935, member: 682"]
You should check diode mode to ground on data lines.
[/QUOTE]
i checked data line diod mode.  
ı wrote above about it On J4500 from its 20-22 R4506 and R4507 seems to be working.    There is line between the socket and resistors

title: 820-3462-A A1425 Doesn't see ssd
message:
SSD data lines have series caps.
Did you check diode mode on the PCH's side of them?
You can also check the other side, when SSD is connected.
